X* WASHINGTON MEETING, JUNE 30, HEPHESENTATIVES EDUCATIONAL TV GROUPS*
I have a 'wire from Skornia saying he is mailing a report to the Board
on this meeting* You may be interested in a brief reaction from me*
1* It was worthwhile to have the top representatives (President or
Chairman of the Board and the Executive 5 of each group get to¬
gether so all would understand better what the others are try¬
ing to do# I am opposed to meetings just for the sake of meet¬
ing, but this group should get together at least twice a year*
2# The meeting engenders a feeling of mutual respect and a sense
of team work*
3* Hie group agreed to meet two more times but not in any sense
as a new council or organization* The purpose of the second
me sting would be to further explore the job ahead, anaylze
resources available and funds needed* The third meeting would
be a conference of this group with representatives of as many
foundations as possible for the purpose of laying out before
foundations the accomplishments to date, the job ahead, and
support needed to do the job* MAEB will not be committed to
give up anything in either of these meetings* Instead, we will
be in a position of cooperating with the other groups, not in
making specific requests but in attempting to involve more
foundation support for the total job to be don®#

JULY 9, 19ft* From the JCET Board meeting in New York on the 7th,
I went to Ann Arbor for an all day meeting of the MASS Advisory Committee
with Dr* Newbum and his staff* Present for NAEB, Probst, Dunn,

This meeting was enlightening, encouraging, and very pleasant* We have
established good rapport*
The morning was devoted to reports on the Center *s progress and plans

Center*
1* Now distributes five hours of programs per day to the six
stations on the air.
2. Is utilizing relatively little material produced by those
stations - because the stations are so involved in these early
stages of operation that they can divert little energy for the
